text:
Blue Giant (Movie)
--------------------

### Introduction

Blue Giant is a Japanese animated film directed by Yuzuru Tachikawa and produced by CoMix Wave Films. The story follows Katsuragi Koji (voiced by Yūki Yamada), who has always been drawn to jazz music and plays the saxophone every day at the riverbank in Sendai. After graduating from high school, he moves to Tokyo and rents an apartment from his former classmate, Yamamoto Jun'ichi (voiced by Okamoto Amane). One day, while performing at an exhibition, Koji meets Sakura Snowe (voiced by Shōtarō Mamiya), a pianist, and invites her to join their jazz band "JASS," which also includes Jun'ichi, who takes up drums after being inspired by Koji. Together, they aim to change the face of jazz music in Japan by performing at the best jazz venue and becoming members of its prestigious club.
